data.title: F8 - go to next error - removes the cursor from the editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.2 (1.10.2)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

This is an FR on the go to next error command. 
Currently the cursor is removed from the code editor when using the go to next error feature.
![mar-24-2017 10-28-52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3452559/24306211/0b1e38b4-107d-11e7-8816-45c9954bf628.gif)

Users are required to click after jumping to the next error before actually being able to fix it. It would be nice if the cursor remained active in the editor when using the shortcut.

data.title: Extend the Functionality of the JavaScript Language Service
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.2 - OS Version: Lubuntu 16.04 (Linux 4.8.0-41-generic) ### The Problem: The JavaScript Language Service doesn't recognize interfaces defined in **.ts** and **.d.ts** files. As a result, interfaces doesn't show up in the _"quick suggestions"_ list. Moreover, interfaces and **even classes** defined in those files cannot be used to declare types using JSDoc comments. This prevents the programmer from taking advantage of the contract defined in the `interface` or `class` to write type-checked and bug-free code. ### The Proposal: JavaScript IntelliSense is provided through the TypeScript Language Service. As of now, the TypeScript Language Service has been used already to provide the same functionality described above in other products. See Here Here is the relevant part of the article: > Because JavaScript and TypeScript are now based on the same language service, they are able to interact in a richer way. For example, JavaScript IntelliSense can be provided for values declared in a .d.ts file, and types such as interfaces and classes declared in TypeScript are available for use as types in JsDoc comments. > > Below, we show a simple example of a TypeScript definition file providing such type information (via an interface) to a JavaScript file in the same project (using a JsDoc tag). It seems possible that we can extend the functionality of the TypeScript Language Service to provide such a cool and needed feature like this. I would love to work on this. Sadly, I don't have experience with the VSCode project. Nevertheless, Everyone in the VSCode community who can help or provide technical insights is very much welcome.

data.title: Powershell start debug from console crash
data.body:
Hello !

The new version with PowerShell is a lot better, still I cannot debug my script by running it through Terminal because PowerShell App will crash.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows Server 2012 R2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have Powershell module for VSCode installed
2. Open Powershell script that use Args
3. Press F5 to debug once (do whatever, stop debug)
4. Put debug point in the script
5. Now I want to run my script with args : 
         -so I type in the Powershell terminal the command with args (with a debug point in the script)
         -As soon as I hit enter to run the command, "Powershell" application crash

You can see on picture bellow 👍 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26656800/24304510/e2fa036c-10b9-11e7-8226-4443a3b4f3b3.png)

Crash detail :

_Problem Event Name:	PowerShell
  NameOfExe:	powershell.exe
  FileVersionOfSystemManagementAutomation:	6.3.9600.17400
  InnermostExceptionType:	System.InvalidOperationException
  OutermostExceptionType:	System.InvalidOperationException
  DeepestPowerShellFrame:	unknown
  DeepestFrame:	rotocol.MessageProtocol.ProtocolEndpoint.SendEvent
  ThreadName:	unknown
  OS Version:	6.3.9600.2.0.0.16.7
  Locale ID:	2057_


This is really blocking to debug, because using F5 and then typing args is loss of time (plus not mandatory args are not used).

Thanks !

data.title: Add advanced, developer focused browsing functionality to vscode.
data.body:
[Suggestion]
## Long version of

### Add advanced, developer focused browsing functionality to vscode.

- Developers don't just code! They also research, sometimes up to 30% (or more) of their time. Hunting  for answers at stackoverflow, reading web based documentation, checking stuff at github etc.
- This is done using the browser of our choice, quickly polluting our desktop workspace with dozens of tabs in multiple browser windows. And yes - unlike editors - browsers didn't change since the invention of tabs almost a decade ago!
- Digging deeper, we will quickly realize that we act as "multiple identities" for different projects, resulting in multiple research-sessions: As developer, as employee, as private person. We spin up the browser every time a new request comes in: Buy that new SDD, research about standard.js, book that travel your girlfriend is desperately waiting for - all while having Typescript-, Babel-, C#- documentation open at the same time.

## The reality: All this happens while coding.

Yes. Coding is writing, but what we do most of the time is reading! And as of today, there is no smart tool for that!

## The suggestion, short version
- Add another Icon (Browser) to the activity bar, so we can open some sort of a tab-/browser history presented as (large) thumbnails in the sidebar comparable to the list of extensions. These previews should be as large as - for example - Safari's Tab preview. 
- This visual history list could show open browser tabs on top (almost like the open editors list) and all others as history tabs below.
- We could also organize our tabs / history of web pages in folder structures like code, however: It might be better to be able to just search our browsing history (which is mostly documentation anyway) from command palette.
- To open one of these pages / tabs / history-URLs we could simply drag them to one of the editor groups, allowing us to split browser windows like we split editors. This way we can view a sample or tutorial on the left and code at the same time on the right. (No more cmd-tab)
- Even better: We could open our running code on the left and our currently running web app on the right! This is more desirable on the mac than on windows, since auto arranging windows isn't so intuitive on the Mac ...

Implementing all this shouldn't be too hard since the editors are HTML, and all the action bar / sidebar / drag&drop / split features are implemented anyway.

But: Doing this well is important. This is why current extensions don't do the job well enough. Visual Studio also has some browsing, but people usually don't use it because it lacks the tab management-, history-, search- and organization features .


## On the long run:

Getting this kind of advanced research-based browsing functionality could even be useful as a separate product. Not just for docs.microsoft.com but for everyone who suffers the "Too many tabs" problem.

What do you think?

data.title: Extensions proxy support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Dear Team, Many thanks for this product used as a replacement of ISE on my every day work.
I work behind a corporate proxy that I manage to set up in vs code, it's working for Vs code update. 
However I get 407 Authentication required when I try to install or check extension. I digg a lot on internet and find some workaround, most deprecated and non working.
Is there a way to make vs code use same proxy for extension and main program ? 

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. set up VS code proxy html : http://username:pass@proxy:port
2. Check for updates : Ok
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26654351/24299643/261eb6de-10aa-11e7-8533-97f5813a7e09.png)

3. Show popular extension : nothing appear and get the 407 in message analyser
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26654351/24299585/f84fe782-10a9-11e7-9d78-4cc45e7eb4a0.png)

Our corporate proxy use basic Auth, I try http.proxyStrictSSL either true or false and get same behavior

data.title: jsdoc @typedef reference don't work after a function declaration
[Insiders] Extension contributed commands in menus are broken
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (e1d2e7b41c22acf9c3f63123842d5231bfbc2fae, 2017-03-24T09:07:42.332Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

---

I'm seeing really strange behavior with commands in menus that are contributed by extensions (seemingly any extension). Commands in anything other than `editor/context` don't seem to work at all, the callback never gets called. And for `editor/context` ones, it seems there is a new argument that looks like keyboard state, but because it is just tacked on to the start of the args it breaks the vast majority of my GitLens commands.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Right-click on a file in the explorer and choose a command contributed by an extension (say Git History, GitLens, Open in GitHub, etc)
2. Nothing happens

data.title: Failure to debug extension properly when a workspace is opened
data.body:
Opening a new issue since I can't reopen the one that was closed without actually helping me. (Debugging a language service when #23035)

>>VSCode Version: 1.10.2 . also does the same thing with today's insider.
>> OS Version: Win10 15061.
>>

When I gave very a specific case where debugging is not working

>>I’m building/launching/debugging the Extension Development Host (and the oop server process) fine from vscode, but if I ‘open a folder (workspace)’, it restarts the Extension Development Host vscode process, and apparently doesn’t load the extension at that point. (and the debuggers have stopped, since the original processes went away). The status bar also turns from purple to blue.

>>If I exit that process and restart from my main vscode again, it starts up the new EHD process in the folder (workspace) that I previously opened (and the status bar is blue), but doesn’t break on any breakpoints in the client and fails to attach to the server. I’m pretty sure that my extension isn’t actually loading in that process (as the stuff I write to the console and/or status bar don’t show up).

>> Is there a means to debug when vscode is in ‘open a folder (workspace)’ mode?

the Illustrious @dbaeumer  replied with:

> If the language server is written in node then this is a good example for how to debug this: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-language-server. If you want to run the server in debug-brk you can change the let debugOptions = { execArgv: ["--nolazy", "--debug=6004"] }; accordingly.

However,  as I mentioned :

> I’m building/launching/**debugging** the Extension Development Host (and the oop server process) **fine** from vscode  

And **Yes**, it is written in node, 

Except, my actual problem is:

>  but if I ‘open a folder (workspace)’, it **restarts** the Extension Development Host vscode process, and **apparently doesn’t load the extension** at that point

And 

> The status bar also turns from purple to blue.

If then I try to

> end that process and restart from my main vscode again by pressing F5,

The experience I then get is :

> it starts up the new EHD process in the folder (workspace) that I previously opened 

Wherein: 

> and the status bar is blue

And the continuing problem is that it :

> **doesn’t break on any breakpoints in the client and fails to attach to the server. **

My guess is that 

> I’m pretty sure that my extension isn’t actually loading in that process 

Because I noticed that 

> as the stuff I write to the console and/or status bar don’t show up

data.title: Terminal task runner: multiple parallel tasks and the spinner

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

We need to decide how to provide user feedback about running tasks. With the old output runner there was only one active task presented by the spinner. With the new terminal task system there can be n active parallel tasks which can not be represented by one spinner.

May be it would be cool to have something in the terminal UI for this and only show the spinner for build tasks. If terminals would be tabs we could add a batch to the tab to indicate activity like in the side bar.

@Tyriar FYI.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (x64)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Developer Tools.
2. Type navigator.userAgent

Result:
See WOW64 instead of Win64, Chrome is still 53 (old)

From https://github.com/electron/electron/releases , Electron supports x64 binaries for Windows. Electron has switched to Chrome 56 since v1.6.x. Is there any reason why VS Code is still very behind in terms of Electron version?

data.title: Can't run node in vagrant image with integratedConsole
data.body:
I'm trying to get VSCode setup so I can compile and debug a node application inside a vagrant VM. Thus far I've got it to the point where one launch task can ssh into the vagrant image, run `gulp` to build and then `node` to execute the task. But the later part _has_ to be done with the integrated terminal, rather than the integrated console. If I let it use the console, it simply shows the command to be executed in the _Debug Console_ view (in yellow) and nothing else. The node process isn't run on the VM.

I have a second launch task that can then be used to attach the debugger to the running instance. Ideally that would be possible with a single launch task, but I can't figure that out (although that isn't the main element of this issue).

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Vagrant VM with node installed
2. launch.json configured thus:

```hs
{
	"version": "0.2.0",
	"configurations": [
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "launch",
			"name": "Build and Run",
			"outFiles": [],
			"preLaunchTask": "default",
			"port": 15858,
			"console": "integratedTerminal",
			"runtimeExecutable": "/usr/bin/vagrant",
			"runtimeArgs": [
				"ssh",
				"-c",
				"cd /proj/core/dist; node --debug=0.0.0.0:5858 index.js"
			]
		},
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "attach",
			"name": "Attach",
			"outFiles": [],
			"port": 15858,
			"address": "localhost",
			"localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
			"remoteRoot": "/proj/core"
		}
	]
}
```

tasks.json for the gulp command:

```js
{
	"version": "0.1.0",
	"command": "vagrant",
	"isShellCommand": true,
	"args": [
		"ssh",
		"-c",
		"cd /proj/core; gulp"
	],
	"tasks": [
		{
			"taskName": "default",
			"args": [],
			"isBuildCommand": true,
			"problemMatcher": [
				"$lessCompile",
				"$tsc",
				"$jshint"
			]
		}
	]
}
```

If I change the command to simply `echo "hello";` (on the local machine) then it executes and shows the response in the debug console as expected, but using vargrant's ssh command at all just doesn't do anything. Checking it to `integratedTerminal` does allow it to run (although as I say, I need another launch config to attach to the process).

data.title: Sync settings between VS code application
data.body: It would be good idea if you provide option to sync settings between VS code between devices.

data.title: Ask user to install missing plugins found in shared workspace configs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.12.3

We'd like to help other developers to easily pick up our projects. To do that we'd like to place `.vscode/settings.json` in our projects. But if some other developer don't have all plugins installed, which we'd like to support, they see _"Unknown configuration setting"_ warnings in the `.vscode/settings.json`. Ideally we'd like to tell new developers to _just download VS Code_ and open one of our projects and it _just works_.

To achieve this we'd need a new feature which asks the user to install missing plugins automatically.

data.title: Feature Request - Optional Manual Formatting
data.body:
I would like a mechanism whereby I can tell VSCode which formatter to apply to a file from whichever formatters are installed. For example I have a .targets file which contains xml however it isn't being formatted and colour coded as XML. What I would like is similar to the Language menu in Notepad++

If such a feature already exists then I apologise as I have not been able to find it

data.title: VSCode seems to reset FETCH_HEAD on its own
data.body: I often use `git fetch <remote> <branch>` by hand from the command line, and when VSCode is opened sometimes `FETCH_HEAD` gets reset to something else than what I just fetched, and I can't locate where it's happening from.

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: master

If a user runs a compile task with attached problem matcher I even want to highlight resource links which indicate a problem (containing line information) and not any arbitrary file. This is why the regexp contains information to match line information.

data.title: Link handler not firing
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: master

I register the following link handler:

regexp: `/^([^\s].*)\((\d+|\d+,\d+|\d+,\d+,\d+,\d+)\):\s+(error|warning|info)\s+(TS\d+)\s*:\s*(.*)$/`
matchIndex: 1

no validator.

However no link is computed in the following terminal output:

```
> tsc -p .
Press any key to close the terminal
HelloWorld.ts(3,17): error TS2339: Property 'loog' does not exist on type 'Console'.
```
However IMO it should match the line.

data.title: Simplified Chinese translation issues list and fix (Part 1)
data.body:
# Environment

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise, Version 1607 (10.0.14393.969)

# Abstract

Though machine-based translation works in most cases, there are lots of minor issues with the current Simplified Chinese translation. A list of translation issues and possible fixes is available below. Due to the time limitation, I can't send all of them at once. I will list more translation issues in a separate issue, or wait for the community translation portal (mentioned in #15077) to become alive later.

# Translation issues

## i18n/chs/src/vs/base/browser/ui/resourceViewer/resourceViewer.i18n.json

### nativeBinaryError

- Current: `文件将不在编辑器中显示，因为它是二进制文件、非常大或使用不支持的文本编码。`
- Issue(s): Syntax issue: Words' order is not correct & Wrong structure
- Suggested Fix: `因为此文件是二进制文件，或文件过大，或使用了不受支持的文本编码，将不会在编辑器中显示。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/base/common/errors.i18n.json

### notImplementedError

- Current: `未实施`
- Issue(s): Translation is not consistent with other Microsoft products and common Chinese usage
- Suggested Fix: `未实现`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/base/common/processes.i18n.json

### ExecutableParser.args

- Current: `警告: args 的类型必须为 string[]。正在忽略值 {0}。`
- Issue(s)： It should be future progressive tense(将忽略值), not present tense(正在忽略值). 
- Suggested Fix: `警告: args 的类型必须为 string[]。将忽略值 {0}。`

### ExecutableParser.invalidCWD

- Current: `警告: options.cwd 的类型必须为字符串。正在忽略值 {0}。`
- Issue(s): See `ExecutableParser.args`
- Suggested Fix: `警告: options.cwd 的类型必须为字符串。将忽略值 {0}。`

### ExecutableParser.isShellCommand

- Current: `警告: isShellCommand 的类型必须为布尔型。正在忽略值 {0}。`
- Issue(s): See `ExecutableParser.args`
- Suggested Fix: `警告: isShellCommand 的类型必须为布尔型。将忽略值 {0}。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/code/electron-main/menus.i18n.json

### miIntroductoryVideos

- Current: `介绍性视频(&&V)`
- Issue(s): It is not necessary to stress "Introductory" as an adjective (介绍性) in Chinese.
- Suggested Fix: `介绍视频(&&V)`

### miKeyboardShortcuts

- Current: `键盘快捷方式引用(&&K)`
- Issue(s): The word "reference" can be translated into different words, depending on the context. "引用" means "mentioning something (e.g. .NET Assembly)". In this case, "reference" means "looking for information" (how to use keyboard shortcuts), which should be translated to "参考".
- Suggested Fix: `键盘快捷方式参考(&&K)`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/code/electron-main/windows.i18n.json

### appStalledDetail

- Current: `可以重新打开或关闭窗，或者保持等待。`
- Issue(s): Not consistent with other translation of "window" (窗口). Translation of "you" is missing.
- Suggested Fix: `你可以重新打开或关闭窗口，或者保持等待。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/browser/actions/configureLocale.i18n.json

### restart

- Current: `要更改值需要重启 VSCode。`
- Issue(s): Syntax issue
- Suggested Fix: `若要更改值，VSCode 需要重启。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/actions.i18n.json

### openIntroductoryVideosUrl

- Current: `介绍性视频`
- Issue(s): See `miIntroductoryVideos`.
- Suggested Fix: `介绍视频`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/crashReporter.i18n.json

### telemetry.enableCrashReporting

- Current: `启用要发送给 Microsoft 的故障报表。\n此选项需重启才可生效。`
- Issue(s): Syntax issue: sentence structure is not clear. Word "报表" is financial-related in Chinese. And the translation is not consistent with other Microsoft products.
- Suggested Fix: `允许将错误报告发送给 Microsoft。\n此选项需重启才可生效。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.i18n.json

### extensionHostProcess.startupFail

- Current: `扩展主机未在 10 秒内启动，这可能是一个问题。`
- Issue(s): Of course this is a problem - extension host doesn't start in 10 seconds. The translation should stress that "something might happened".
- Suggested Fix: `扩展主机未在 10 秒内启动，可能发生了一个问题。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.i18n.json

### runningAsRoot

- Current: `不建议将 Code 作为“根”运行。`
- Issue(s): It is not necessary to translate "root" user to "根".
- Suggested Fix: `不建议以 “root” 用户身份运行 Code。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/electron-main/windows.i18n.json

### appStalledDetail

- Current: `可以重新打开或关闭窗，或者保持等待。`
- Issue(s): See another `appStalledDetail`.
- Suggested Fix: `你可以重新打开或关闭窗口，或者保持等待。`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/parts/welcome/page/electron-browser/vs_code_welcome_page.i18n.json

### welcomePage.stackOverflow

- Current: `堆栈溢出`
- Issue(s): It refers StackOverFlow.com. According to Microsoft localization guideline, first-level product name should not be translated unless it has a localized name. Stack Overflow doesn't have one.
- Suggested Fix: `Stack OverFlow`

### welcomePage.introductoryVideos

- Current: `介绍性视频`
- Issue(s): See `miIntroductoryVideos`.
- Suggested Fix: `介绍视频`

### welcomePage.interfaceOverview

- Current: `接口概述`
- Issue(s): The word **interface**'s meaning differs according to context. For here, it should be "user interface"(用户界面), not the "interface"(接口) in programming language.
- Suggested Fix: `用户界面概述`

### welcomePage.interfaceOverviewDescription

- Current: `获取突出显示 UI 主要组件的视觉覆盖`
- Issue(s): Syntax error and incomplete translation.
- Suggested Fix: `使用视觉覆盖层突出显示用户界面的主要组件`

### welcomePage.interactivePlaygroundDescription

- Current: `请在简短演练中试用编辑器的基本功能`
- Issue(s): It is not necessary to use imperative mood here.
- Suggested Fix: `在简短演练中试用编辑器的基本功能`

## i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/common/taskConfiguration.i18n.json

- Current: `警告: options.cwd 必须属于字符串类型。正在忽略值 {0}\n`
- Issue(s): See `ExecutableParser.invalidCWD`
- Suggested Fix: `警告: options.cwd 必须属于字符串类型。将忽略 {0} 值\n`

data.title: Should we allow to execute tasks in the extension host

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12

In VS Code 1.12. there will be API to contribute tasks to the Run Task drop down. This will for example support cases were an extension wants to contribute task generated from special built tools which we don't want to hard code (make, cmake, npm, ant, ...)

I am pretty sure that users will ask soon to support something like Task.execute() to execute a task created in the extension in a terminal.

@Tyriar what is your take on this. You might want to look at the task API in vscode.proposed.d.ts. A task could offer some listening on output as well which would scope the output to the creator of the task.

data.title: Wrong value of "this" in debugger (JavaScript Arrow Function)
Copy from terminal should not retain new line characters for wrapped lines
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode 1.10.2 
Fixation 8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331 
Date 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z 
Shell 1.4.6  
Handler 53.0.2785.143 
Node 6.5.0:
- OS Version: Linux user 4.4.0-67-generic #88-Ubuntu SMP Wed Mar 8 16:34:45 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create python script:
```python
#!/bin/env python3

line = """ "{ \"package\": {\"type\": \"tcp\", \"total_length\" :0, \"header_length\": 0, \"body_length\": 0, \"TCP\": {\"source_port\": -1, \"dest_port\": -1, \"seq_num\": -1, \"ack_num\": -1, \"flag_urgent\": false, \"flag_ack\": false, \"flag_push\": false, \"flag_reset\": false, \"flag_sync\": false, \"flag_finish\": false, \"window\": -1, \"checksum\": -1, \"urgent_pointer\": -1 }}}" """

print(line.replace('\"', '"'))
```

2. Right click->Run python file in terminal
3. Copy data from terminal:
```
"{ "package": {"type": "tcp", "total_length" :0, "header_length": 0, "body_length": 0, "TCP": {"source
_port": -1, "dest_port": -1, "seq_num": -1, "ack_num": -1, "flag_urgent": false, "flag_ack": false, "fl
ag_push": false, "flag_reset": false, "flag_sync": false, "flag_finish": false, "window": -1, "checksum
": -1, "urgent_pointer": -1 }}}"
```
Words "source_port" and "flag_push" and quotes on ' "checksum" ' are changed. So when I copy this text to https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/ I've got invalid json. 

What words are broken, depends on VSCode window size. When I made it large or small, different words became corrupted.
